thread.title: International Women's Day to bring assembly, march to Downtown
thread.title_full: International Women's Day to bring assembly, march to Downtown

author: Pittsburgh Post-Gazette
title: International Women's Day to bring assembly, march to Downtown
text:
International Women's Day to bring assembly, march to Downtown March 8, 2017 12:10 AM Pavel Golovkin/Associated Press Customers buy flowers at a flower market on the eve of the International Women's Day in Moscow, Russia on Tuesday.   
About 200 people are expected for a Downtown assembly and march Wednesday to mark International Women’s Day. 
The public event is set to begin about 4 p.m. at the City-County Building portico, 414 Grant St., according to a city permit application from the International Women’s Day Planning Committee. 
Later, the group will march down Grant Street to the William S. Moorhead federal building, 1000 Liberty Ave., and assemble there, the application shows. 
Pittsburgh city spokesman Timothy McNulty said marchers plan to use the sidewalk after 6 p.m. 
A committee representative could not be reached immediately Tuesday, but the application indicates the event is in concert with women in 40 countries and more than a dozen U.S. cities. It should conclude by 7 p.m. 
Dating to the early 1900s, International Women’s Day celebrates the social, cultural and political achievements of women while urging gender equality, according to a website for the global campaign . 
Related events in the Pittsburgh area include a walkout set for shortly after 3 p.m. Wednesday at Carnegie Mellon University. Participants in that gathering, part of “A Day Without A Woman,” will join the Downtown assembly, a Facebook event listing shows. Related Media:
